leds_h.powerLED_Txt1a: The Power Indicator LED on the
leds_h.powerLED_Txt1b: can be configured to behave in different ways, according to requirements. The available options are:
leds_h.powerLED_Txt2: Normal - The power LED shows steady green during normal operation.
leds_h.powerLED_Txt3a: Off - The power LED is off during normal operation. This can be useful in making the
leds_h.netLED_Txt1a: The Network Indicator LED on the
leds_h.netLED_Txt1b: can be enabled or disabled, according to requirements. The available options are:
leds_h.netLED_Txt2: Enabled - The network LED lights up for network traffic.
leds_h.netLED_Txt3a: Disabled - The network LED is off during normal operation and is not lit at all. This can be useful in making the
leds_h.netLED_Txt4: When enabled, the network LED flashes amber for activity on a 10 Mbps network and green for activity on a 100 Mbps network. The LED shows steady red for a hardware error.
leds_h.netLEDGigabit_Txt: When enabled, the network LED flashes amber for activity on a 10 Mbps and 100 Mbps network, and flashes green for activity on a 1000 Mbps network. The LED shows steady red for a hardware error.
leds_h.statusLED_Txt1a: The Status Indicator LED on the
leds_h.statusLED_Txt1b: can be configured to behave in different ways, according to requirements. The available options are:
leds_h.statusLED_Txt2: Normal - The status LED shows steady green during normal operation.
leds_h.statusLED_Txt3a: Off - The status LED is off during normal operation. This can be useful in making the
leds_h.power_led_note: Note: The Power and Network indicators on the wireless module cannot be disabled.
